origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Albany

did.abstract: Collection is made up of the publication the Theater Annual.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The SUNY Theater Annual was first published in 1942 by the Theater Library Association. The publication covered theater history as well as current events, discussing important actors and productions. Publication of the Annual was taken over by John V. Falconieri while at the Western Reserve University. He moved to the University at Albany who continued publication through the 1960s as a member of the Department of Romance Languages.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains selections from The Theater Annual, a journal that for a time was published by the State University of New York at Albany. It contains essays on theater history and current players and productions.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged in chronological order.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were donated to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this record group is unrestricted.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: This page may contain links to digital objects. Access to these images and the technical capacity to download them does not imply permission for re-use. Digital objects may be used freely for personal reference use, referred to, or linked to from other web sites.
Researchers do not have permission to publish or disseminate material from these collections without permission from an archivist and/or the copyright holder.

The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming to the laws of copyright. Some materials in these collections may be protected by the U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) and/or by the copyright or neighboring-rights laws of other nations. More information about U.S. Copyright is provided by the Copyright Office. Additionally, re-use may be restricted by terms of University Libraries gift or purchase agreements, donor restrictions, privacy and publicity rights, licensing and trademarks.
The University Archives are eager to hear from any copyright owners who are not properly identified so that appropriate information may be provided in the future.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

Identification of specific item, series, box, folder, SUNY Theater Annual Collection, 1999-2006. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the SUNY Theater Annual Collection).
